website_summaries.verdict: We love the Petmate dog crate for its attractive design and portability. However, this crate is not ideal for dogs that chew plastic or need a crate with lots of visibility.
pros: Petmate's line of durable yet lightweight plastic dog crates are easy to take along when traveling
This brand stands out for superior ventilation that many plastic dog crates lack
cons: This crate model is more difficult to assemble than collapsible metal dog crates, and not as durable

customer_reviews.title: Great for big dogs!
customer_reviews.text: We got the 40" kennel for my 60 lb boxer after he shredded a metal kennel as if it was made of styrofoam! He actually likes going into this one, not like the other one. He doesn't try to break out of this one, I don't think he could if he tried.
customer_reviews.author: ChillMill

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Got it with 50% off. Bought two. Both fit with a little help in my Toyota Prados trunk, I am just soo happy. My german shepherd and my boxer fit well for car rides (for airplane I will need the 40" because of the heigh). I elected this model because it is very light in compair with other kennels I have seen, the kennel I had before I couldn't carry alone, this kennel I can. Door opens on both sides, good ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Great crate for 2 small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 9 pound Yorkie and a 12 pound Shitzu/Maltese mix. I wanted something that could fit both dogs. I got one of those metal crate but my dogs refused to go on it. I got them this and they loved it. Both dogs fit and they like to go in. I wish the crate was lower but it works.
customer_reviews.author: #truth

customer_reviews.title: NOT durable.
customer_reviews.text: We received this item broken. The lid of the kennel was cracked in the back. Let me say this kennel reflects it's price. It is very cheaply made. This plastic crap quality. I would absolutely never purchase this for airline travel. Since we are only using it in our house I don't mind but if you're looking for something tough and sturdy this is NOT it.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Works great to carry my pet rabbits to the vet
customer_reviews.text: Works great to carry my pet rabbits to the vet. It's solid and sturdy. I have only used it to carry one rabbit at a time, but it can definitely fit both of my rabbits. They're around 3-4lbs as of now.
customer_reviews.author: Revly

customer_reviews.title: I like these kennels a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like these kennels a lot. I had the size smaller and it was very sturdy and the door closed extremely smooth, so when my dog outgrew it, I ordered this next size from Amazon. I was very disappointed when it arrived as the door wouldn't close easily at all. I certainly didn't want to use two hands and force the door closed each time, so I figured it was defective, returned it and ordered a replacement. The new one was perfect. That is why I'm only giving it 4 stars. Take note though if you order one and the door doesn't close smoothly, return it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gebke

customer_reviews.title: Not Airline Approved
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this for animal transport on airplanes. This kennel is no longer accepted as of Oct. 1. The bottom shell should be a hard plastic not a "basket type" shell with ventalation holes. Super misleading on this description and do not book with United airlines. It has been a nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL POS
customer_reviews.text: I bought the larger one & tried everything I could possibly think of to assemble this and it’s useless. It doesn’t fit together, the top is too big for the bottom, the door doesn’t fit, the bolt holes don’t line up, and forget traveling with it. There’s no handle to carry it. You’d have to put it in your vehicle and then ad the pet afterward. I wasn’t concerned about that. I just wanted it for my little guy to sleep in a night, so that wasn’t a big concern for me, but it could be for someone else. It’s a complete piece of crap and it’s gohbg back ASAP. 2 laundry baskets tied together could do the same job.
customer_reviews.author: D. Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than advertised size
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 50-70lbs crate which is advertised to be 36.1"x23.3"x26.7" . This is not the dimensions usable by your Pet. The floor inside the crate is 30"x18". The height inside is 25.5". The crate has a lip where the top and bottom are put together. Inside the crate at the lip it is 32.5"x 22.25". I ordered a 34"x22" bed to go inside the crate and it does not fit. My opinion is that the dimensions should be the usable INSIDE dimensions by your pet. NOT the outside dimensions including a lip on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Al P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mid sized crate, durable, easy to breakdown and reassemble
customer_reviews.text: I've had many types of pet crates, especially airline type kennels like these. They're all pretty much the same.. This one is just fine and it's easy to assemble. What I like about this one in particular is the front door opens from the left or right side. If you need the door off to have better access to the inside of the crate, you'll simply twist both latches and the door pulls off completely, goes back on just as easy. I would recommend this crate to any one with a puppy that will grow to around 25 pounds or so, or it's also a great starter crate for any puppy of any breed.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. RL

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble assembling this. Took me around 20 mins total. The top and bottom part have to line up just right and for some reason it was a little difficult to get everything to line up how it’s supposed it. Once it’s together though it seems to stay together. I used it to take my cat to the vet. She’s not very hefty or big in size and i could carry her around in this just fine. There isn’t too much room in it so if you want something your pet can move around in might not get the small size.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney W.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality just took 2x to get it...
customer_reviews.text: The 1st kennel we received was cracked so they sent us a new one (pending the return of the 1st)... received the 2nd one and it seems to be scuffed up and not “brand new”. For the price, I would expect it to be scuff free and free of any scratches or markings :/ Overall love the design/look of the kennel Seems to be very sturdy and well made Door latch/opening and closing is nice Assuming there is no carrier holder/handle on the top to carry it because of the size we purchased
customer_reviews.author: Kaylee

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 amazing cage
customer_reviews.text: This is the PERFECT cage we bought. Trust me we have bought 3 before this and returned them all. They were either too small, damaged or way bigger than the description said. This came well packaged, new and it was the perfect size. We have a corgi and this gives her a good amount of room to stand up and move around. It easy to assemble and I love how the door opens from either side. It locks very well, making it hard for the door to open while traveling. Like the other cages we got. My only con is there no handle. But that can be over looked because all in all I give this cage a 10/10
customer_reviews.author: FiscallyFitFamily

customer_reviews.title: Know what you're getting
customer_reviews.text: I paid more than sixty dollars for this flimsy plastic trash, including shipping. First thing I noticed was that it is not the high quality that I've purchased at pet stores in the past. Since I've been using it, the door has continually fallen off. Even when I get it on, I cannot get it to shut. I have my husband do it because I do not have the patience. I recommend buying this particular product at the pet store so you'll know what ;you're getting and you can buy it for twenty dollars less because you won't have to pay for shipping. I am disappointed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Santa Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Best create we've owned so far (4 so far)
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for our mid-sized dog (50 lbs). He is an active Brittany and loves to hide out in his crate when he wants to get some rest or is feeling overwhelmed (we have lots of friends whom all have lots of kids). He knows that it is his place and he will be safe inside. Works great for the car too, but normally needs to go in the back of the Explorer or Escape (no third row). I love the ambi-door - can open either left or right at any time. Makes taking the door off super easy too. He loves it and it's built well. Thumbs up from this Hunting Dog owner.
customer_reviews.author: JonTheCanadian

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS THROUGH AMAZON
customer_reviews.text: The crate itself would be fine, but it came without the necessary materials to put it together and Amazon's ONLY fix for this is to disassemble and rebox the entire thing and send it back for a replacement. They won't send the needed hardware. And while there is a link to the Petmate website to ask for help, Petmate does not work with Amazon so they cannot help with this issue. God forbid a multi billion dollar company send someone a set of screws... That would be TOO MUCH!!! gross. But directly from Petmate if you can
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this less than 6 months ago, and the door has completely fallen apart; it is useless without a door. This crate comes with two latches on the door, so you can open it to the left or the right. Seems like a good idea, except that the latches are garbage. And once the springs have fallen out, you no longer have a door. The side I never used to open and close the crate is the side that fell apart. Not to mention how difficult it was to line up the pegs in the holes whenever I wanted to shut it. I have plastic crates from Petmate that have lasted 13 years. This has been problematic from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara F.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Perfect for Medium Sized Animals
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our cat who is just under 14 pounds. After searching quite a bit online, I was concerned that many of the less expensive ones would be too small for her. I'm glad we went with this size! She was only going to the vet for her vaccines, but it was roomy enough for her and she didn't totally freak out. If you have a cat or dog under 10 pounds, you could probably go with a smaller size, but this is what I'd recommend for the 11-17 pound size animals. Sturdy, easy to put together and stores nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: NOT STURDY
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 year old BLIND shih-tzu. He has always been crated at night and when we are gone. He scratches at the door on occasion if he needs to use the restroom while he is crated. After using this crate for less than 2 months, the wires on the door have broken away and are sticking into the area where the dog is in the crate. This is so dangerous for my boy because he can't see them and they could easily stab him in his eye! I have never had a crate come apart like this, and especially after less than 2 months. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: B. Myers

customer_reviews.title: Matches Description - Was sent a used product
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Seems sturdy Size is roughly what I was expecting maybe on the small side The door opens in either direction which is nice The latch to lock/unlock for opening is easy to use Relatively easy to assemble Cons: Was covered in grass, dirt, and hair when I got it (obviously used) Had brown and black scuffs all over the white top Had a crack on the side where you are expected to slide the two pieces together All in all I probably wouldn't recommend Petmate since they sent out a used product. However besides being dirty and cracked it's exactly what you imagine you are buying when reading the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this believing it had an easy slide off and easily secured top. This is necessary for me because at the vet's office, it's necessary to removed the carrier top to get my uncooperative cat out of the cage. However, to remove the top of this cage, one has to dismantle the cage. There are 4 screws as well as the slide on top, which incidentally does not slide easily because the plastic is rather flimsy. This carrier is not as advertised. If you don't intend to remove the top except for cleaning, it would probably serve the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Cordelia

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The video clearly shows a lock in the back that locks the two halves together. There was no lock on mine, only six bolts with plastic locking hex nuts, three of which could not be forced through the predrilled and poorly aligned holes, together or apart. What a piece of sh@t! I’m sending this back. It’s not as pictured, and not as seen in the video, AND it doesn’t work to boot. Amazon and it’s vendors clearly never looked at what they were shipping. I’m going to buy one in a store instead. Extremely disappointed by this product. Should get ZERO stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Smith

customer_reviews.title: Don’t go by weight
customer_reviews.text: The crate itself is durable and well made. Overall, I’m happy with the crate. With that being said, here is what I don’t like: Don’t use the weight system. I bought the size rated as 50-70 pounds because my quickly growing puppy should end up in the 50s when he’s finished growing. Currently he isn’t even 50 pounds and he’s smushed in the crate. The crate is also difficult to slide the top & bottoms together. Each time I’ve assembled it, it’s been a frustrating task. Overall, the crate is great & I’ll be purchasing another one that will fit my dog as he grows.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does what its made for
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I use this to transport my Chihuahua. The gate opening opens from both sides which is nice if you want to remove it entirely but the latches are hard to position into place sometimes when locking. Have to assemble when received. The top and bottom part are separate and held together with screws. Pros and cons of that are; if you have a hard time getting your pet in or out of the crate, you can remove the entire top part. Con: it takes forever to unscrew and re-screw on the top part (there are a lot screws).
customer_reviews.author: christina o.

customer_reviews.title: Seems really cheap.
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 other Petmate kennels and they've held up well. This one however after only a couple weeks or so one of the two door latches just flew to pieces. I put it back together and the same thing. The other side latch hasn't broken so maybe its faulty. I can tell you it looks really cheaply made compared to the other kennels we have for our Papillon's. I had to file the floor down a bit to get rid of the casting seams and ridges that we thought might injure our Pap's feet.
customer_reviews.author: Flenn

customer_reviews.title: Great crate for my puppy
customer_reviews.text: After getting my 11 week puppy, I ordered this crate in an effort to get a full nights sleep. I've been youtubing a ton on how to crate train and when I put this crate in my pup's playpen, I was very surprised that she went into the crate right away out of curiosity. My pup is still teething so gnaws on this crate all the time and after 5 weeks, it's still holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Desi

customer_reviews.title: Great kennel for several reasons!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kennel because it's vented all around! It was shipped without any packaging and arrived somewhat scuffed. It assembles very easily and the door opens either way which is wonderful! You can use it or take it out completely, as I did, so my little guy can go in and out without having the door in the way. Also, the door has turn dials for opening so you don't have to pinch them together like other kennel doors. All-in-all, it's just great!
customer_reviews.author: Kj1011

customer_reviews.title: Quality control didn’t go to work this shift.
customer_reviews.text: I think the quality control department took a shift off. A row of vents were filled with thin molded plastic that had to be cut out. There were plastic remnants that prevented latching mechanism from, well, latching. The wingnuts and bolts don’t match. I was able to make the fixes, but wouldn’t order product/brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda M. Michelson

customer_reviews.title: Nice Crate, Sturdy, But Smudges
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the crate for my 4.5 lb Pom, she has ample room and honestly loves her crate. I put a beach towel at the bottom for her cushion and she goes in without me having to 'put' her in there. However, upon receiving the crate, it had several smudges on it. I was going to let it go, but Mom insisted that I inform people of the smudges. It shouldn't have come that way brand new. That is the reason for the lower star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as the video
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 20-30lb carrier after watching the video of how easy it was to put together. The one I got doesn't have the clips it has screws that don't all line up. I'm really getting tired of products being misrepresented.
customer_reviews.author: Bear's mom

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase. Worthwhile getting.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this. The largest one available for my German Shepard. It seems roomy enough for her. She can turn around easily and lie down comfortably. While the plastic is fairly thin, once the top and bottom are snapped and bolted together, it seems pretty sturdy. The chrome door seems pretty strong and allows you to open to the left or right as there are two handle switches. My door arrived slightly damaged in shipping, it didn't affect functionality and Amazon handled the issue very quickly. Kudos. After I received this model, I discovered that there was a more heavy duty model destined for flights for $44 more. Had I seen that, I would have bought that instead.
customer_reviews.author: JustTheFacts

customer_reviews.title: It Isn't That Difficult to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: My kennel came yesterday and I am very impressed with it so far! It is very sturdy and I love the two-tone look (fits into my modern apartment). I was a little worried about putting it together based on some of the reviews, but it really wasn't that bad. It took a few tries to get everything lined up, but you just have to be patient. TIP: before you start screwing the bolts in first make sure the top and bottom are aligned by taking 1 bolt and making sure it will fit through all of the holes. Then you can screw it in.
customer_reviews.author: Haley Lohr

customer_reviews.title: Size is perfect but this is very flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised at how light weight and flimsy the plastic is compared to other plastic kennels and carriers I've had in the past. All in all it won't matter to much as this is a temporary size as my puppy grows into a larger kennel. When it comes time to get the next size, it won't be this line of kennels.
customer_reviews.author: Pats fan

customer_reviews.title: Good Dog Box
customer_reviews.text: I use this dog box to keep my small dog in at night, to prevent him from causing mischief. He like it very much (with a nice soft pillow). He often prefers to sleep in the dog box during the day with the door open. I like the latch and double swing door on this model compared to most on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Bob

customer_reviews.title: Double sided door
customer_reviews.text: I love that you can have the door swing left or right or remove it all together. We put this cage together in a few moments. We leave the door off now so she can go in and out as she wants too. But when we need to travel it breaks down pretty easy and our baby is secure when we leave he home alone.
customer_reviews.author: cheffgirl

customer_reviews.title: Nice design, but a little flimsy, use with caution in car
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a nice mid-sized crate. Nice lock-together design. But it is a lightweight plastic - looks and feels like a laundry basket. It's roomy- has a lot of height which is nice for my dog, BUT my medium sized border collie flipped it over in my car. Because of height and weight it isn't stable in a car. VERY IMPORTANT it should be secured in a car. Bungee cords work well, attach to hooks in car back.
customer_reviews.author: 2 black dogs

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are misleading
customer_reviews.text: Kennel arrived quickly but carton was crushed and one of the long sides was completely open although kennel seemed to be intact and all parts present. Specifically ordered the model with a chrome door, but received a model with a painted black door. Listed dimensions are clearly deceiving and show just the outside measurements; interior floor size is not mentioned anywhere but is much smaller and more crowded than implied by the product description.
customer_reviews.author: Bill T.

customer_reviews.title: Petmate makes great crates!!
customer_reviews.text: The best things about these crates are that they are easy to put together & have much better air circulation than any other portable crates I have looked at. Also, the door can be opened from either side without having to change anything. We have 3, one small one that she grew out of in 3 weeks!! And then we skipped the medium & went right to large...2 of them, one for upstairs & one for downstairs & travel, because it's just too much of a pain to schlep the large ones up & down the stairs!! :o)
customer_reviews.author: L.C.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 year--wish it has been longer
customer_reviews.text: Had this for almost exactly a year. After several months struggled through my dog popping off the plastic covers on the latches. She never managed to escape, however, until today. The metal on the door was broken in one spot, and she again snapped off the plastic cover and managed to push out the springs with her claws. Certainly room for design improvement. Why not screw in these plastic covers instead of just having them snap on?
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. We bought three and they are super spacious, even for our fat cat. Two of our cuddly cats can even share one (which they love to do.) I love that the doors can open in any direction. The only problem is that they aren't quite as sturdy as I had hoped. The sliding / locking mechanisms on the sides of the carrier aren't quite as stiff as you'd expect.. so sometimes they don't fit exactly right. Just make sure you have it locked together and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: BicyclingVegan

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made and not safe !
customer_reviews.text: Made very poorly. It looks like to plastic laundry baskets. The easy slide method would be fine if it actually was the right size but of course it wasn't. The door is so flimsy . It opens on both sides but falls right off when you open it. The screws to put into the holes to kept it secure were too long so you couldn't safely secure it without using zip ties. Very big and tall and just poorly made, very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Travelergirl

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this today. Easy to put together and my pup could not wait to get in it!!! I have a 13lbs shih Tzu and I got the M size .I wanted him to have room to stand up and move around..He loves to just hang out in the kennel it's his safe spot.the one he had was to small.this is perfect!! This is him 5 min after I put it together
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally one that works.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is fat and stubborn with claws. This finally kept him tame for traveling and the soft Round holes dont hurt him when he puts his nose in. Other kennels skinned him since they dipped at the bottom. Love it thanks will purchase another if we get a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: The crate measurement SCANDAL!!!
customer_reviews.text: This review is not about the quality of the product, but the lack of information in the description or specifications. I purchased this crate using the measurements provided in the specifications, which stated that it measurements are 28" x 20" x 19.2" and will accommodate a dog who weights 20-30 lb. What the description doesn't tell the consumer is that the measurements are from the exterior of the crate. That would be fine, if you bought the crate for your 21LB dog to sleep on top of the crate!!! In hide sight, find out if the measurements listed are of the interior.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford Fong

customer_reviews.title: Good for vet visits
customer_reviews.text: Not as sturdy as older Petmate carrier. Would not use this for travel. Ok for trips to the vet. The bottom part of the carrier is split on the end, but the delivery box was not damaged; so it appears to have been packed and shipped in a damaged condition. I’m one day too late for a return to Amazon (my fault), so I will contact Petmate directly and try to purchase a replacement piece.
customer_reviews.author: Cardinal

customer_reviews.title: Good product for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: Very good value for the money. Assembles easily, and the latch engagement mechanism is much easier to use than other styles for children. I would purchase this brand / line again for an in home solution, or to put in the back of a vehicle. I have not tested this as an air transporte solution and cannot comment on the durability under that usage; however, it seems reasonably well made and based on ownership of several types/brands over the decades, I would not worry about it. It seems substantial enough for some hard use scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: cjs

customer_reviews.title: Got the smallest size, and size matters!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard for me to rate this. I bought the smallest size for my cat, not really aware of how the sizes work. Unfortunately it was too small but it would do a decent job for ferrets, rabbits or pets of equal stature. To give you an idea, I provided a picture of the actual size in comparison to my size 7 1/2 foot. It came with all the pieces, but it certainly couldn't handle a heavy/fat animal. Overall, if it was what I was looking for it'd be fine.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS RICHARD

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap. Very light and poor construction
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Very light and poor construction. The normal routine going to the vet is as follows : Trying to get your cat to go in carrier is a job in itself ! While on the table at the vet, try and get your cat out of the carrier! He ain't gonna come out ! You have to take the carrier apart and remove the cat ! With this carrier, your vet will charge you extra time, waiting for you to put this peice of crap back together ! I returned this item for a refund !
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Door is not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My dog bent the poles of the door, very easily; some he even broke off. He also got the handles to bust off. And apparently there is no such thing has buying just the door. The plastic part of the kennel is okay, the clasps/hooks in the back can easily be broken off. Only plus is it is easy to put together and take apart to spray off and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Consider buying a different brand
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this kennel, and how it supposedly slides to lock. However, the top does not fit to the bottom precisely enough for me to insert two of the bolts (in the rear of the kennel) to keep it secure. The front bolt holes line up exactly, as do the front tie-down holes, but none of the rear holes aligns correctly. I can't even insert the two bolts. I've emailed the company; I sure hope they'll make this right. I bring my new shelter dog home tomorrow and I don't know if this kennel is secure enough for her to stay in it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I wont fault the seller or the case for this being smaller than I thought. We rescued a beautiful cat who was 11mos old. She barely had room to move. So this for a kitten would be great. Only thing that I did not like was the gate portion had some sharp edges. Little fingers had to be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Gingersnaped

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cat carrier
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe this is so cheap! It's large enough to fit a fat cat (~12 lbs) and is extremely sturdy. The dog jumped on our old crate, and it completely caved in, but this one has no problems like that. It's held together with the provided screws, and has guards to put on the bottoms of those screws so they never come off by accident. The plastic is smooth and makes for easy cleaning, and the door is steel (I think?) and is extremely sturdy. Also comes with a handle. Best value for the price, hands-down.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy and you can hose it out!
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC! The large fit my 50 lb border collie. There are plenty of vent holes, the crate is super sturdy and I can even hose it out after we go to the beach. This thing has been a life saver and I wish I had gotten it years ago - it keeps my dog from jumping around the car and barking when we go out! Seriously a great and well made crate!
customer_reviews.author: Maria C Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and well made, for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A lot sturdier than expected. I bought this at the last minute, looking for the cheapest price possible. As such, I half-expected total garbage quality. It managed to keep my two outdoor cats contained while on their journey to the doctor. On the return trip home, they were just about fed up with the activities of the day and were pretty intent on getting out, scratching and prying their way out the entire car ride home -- but to no avail, the carrier held out like a champ! Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Good kennel; No handle
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to. I like the alternative door latches (there's two) on this kennel as opposed to the traditional push-up and push-down at the same time door latches. That is the reason I researched and purchased this kennel. I would give it five stars however it does not have a handle on the top! What?! I purchased the kennel advertised for dogs 20-30 lbs. This would be a nice feature for placing the kennel in different places in the house or between the house and the car. I think I read that the larger sizes come with handles. I'm not sure why that makes sense for only the larger ones to have handles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome such great price for the kennel we were expecting crap quality for the construction but we put this together 6 months ago take my Cat to the vet once every 3 months in this and to his sitters house when we leave town and he loves it we say Zak kennel and he runs in with his toy and enjoys the ride very satisfied. I saw a similar kennel at petsmart same size for 55$ so paying around 30$ is awesome No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Nat3rT4ter

customer_reviews.title: It needs a handle to carry~~~~~
customer_reviews.text: Wish it had a handle for carrying into the car/getting it out of the car. I would have rated it with 5 stars if it had handle. Otherwise my medium sized 19 pound doxie finds it to be usable!!!
customer_reviews.author: doxie lover

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy door
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived this crate was already scratched up but Amazon was nice in refunded part of the purchase price. However we soon found that although this kennel is rated for 50 to 70 lb dogs it could not hold a 40-something pound dog. The metal door bench within a couple weeks and we send it back to get our money back
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Gee

customer_reviews.title: Loved it so much we've bought three
customer_reviews.text: In this picture our puppy was 2 months old and 13 lbs so we started out with the crate for dogs 20-30 lbs. We're now on our third crate (for dogs 50-70 lbs) and can't say enough good things about it! We originally had one of those metal wire crates, but after reading some warnings about how dogs can get their dew claws caught on the larger holes, we looked for a plastic crate. It's super easy to assemble and lightweight, but sturdy! I think our dog also likes that he can see out in all directions in this crate.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrid product.
customer_reviews.text: You’ll need at least 3 people and a hammer to put this together. This kind of USA workmanship is why people began buying foreign cars years ago. The parts don’t fit, full of design flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Lola L. Potter

customer_reviews.title: I LIKE THIS KENNEL because truthfully it is the ONLY KENNEL ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I'd give it 5 stars except it was really difficult to put together. The video shows it sliding into place in 1 minute - this was not my experience, at all. HOWEVER! I LIKE THIS KENNEL because truthfully it is the ONLY KENNEL that will keep my dog inside. I had to go through 3 kennels because my husky could find his way out of them, but this one keeps him safe inside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: As the old saying goes you get what you pay for. This is cheaply made but I did not pay much. But it works for taking a small dog or cat to the vet or the groomer. The plastic is not as sturdy as they used to be and the holes don't line perfect but with a bit of wiggling you can make it work.
customer_reviews.author: dog_woman

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my Brittney Spaniel. To top it off it fit nested in the front of my car for a 2 day moving trip. It was light weigh enough to carry in the hotels and easy to put together. It was like a car seat for momma's boy. Tyrion was very happy with it. Now he uses it as his house and its a great size for him. I may need to go up a size when he is full grown but for the price I am fine with that.
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Good crate
customer_reviews.text: We got this as a bigger crate for our 5.5 month old Labrador. It looks exactly like her old crate but bigger, she took to this new crate right away. Loves it already and sleeps in it every day no problem. We also take the door completely off during the day, it helps her go in and out of it throughout the day. Easy to assemble, sliding the roof onto the base takes a little bit of time to line up correctly, but one person can definitely assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: Val K

customer_reviews.title: Collapses nicely, great for travel. Lightweight for it's size.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our large dog. Collapses nicely for travel inside the car (our vehicle is a little too short to put it in the car fully assembled), but gives our pup a 'space of their own' during long car rides.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Broken on Delivery
customer_reviews.text: I had this crate delivered to Tennessee where I went to pick up a puppy. We needed the crate for our 1500 mile trip home. When I opened the crate in a hotel parking lot to get ready to go pick up our puppy, I discovered that it was already broken - the plastic was cracked in two places on each side of the top preventing it from snapping together in the correct way!!! Unfortunately, I had no choice but to go ahead and use it. I consider this purchase a waste of money. It was clearly designed to be easy to ship not to be a secure, permanent container.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: So I now have 2 useless crates that I need for my move since I ...
customer_reviews.text: Only 1 stars (at this moment) because I ordered 3 and the order only came with 1 set of the nuts and wings needed to assemble the crates. So I now have 2 useless crates that I need for my move since I have 3 cats and I don't want to move them one at a time. Other than that it was an easy assemble minus the fact that one of the nuts I had to practically force into the hole because it didn't fit right.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hartz

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy as a permanent placement, but bulky to move around
customer_reviews.text: Pros Sturdy Cons : For us it was difficult to put together, especially since we will be traveling it would need to be put together numerous time, at every motel. the 2 halves do not go together very easily and the bolt holes do not line up as they should making it very difficult to assemble and dissemble.. Like smaller units this one did not have a carrying handle which makes it difficult just to handle. Sorry but i will need to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Denny's Apology

customer_reviews.title: Life saver.
customer_reviews.text: I love the double hinge! I didn't realize how handy it would be until the new puppy had an "accident" in it and it made 1. Getter her out without as much mess easier 2. Clean up much easier as I could clean it without the door on at all. Also it does come apart easier than others I have had which also aids in mess cleanups as well as travel/storage. The only downfall (and it's really not that big) is it seems to be slightly thinner plastic.
customer_reviews.author: MBuzz

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE:  Very POOR SIZE info by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Amazon only gave the weight of the dog for the size. The label on the Petmate Compass crate in the store, also included the height of the dog the crate fits. Height is actually more important than weight so the dog can stand up. I had to return the crate and the shipping was subtracted from my refund even though I am a Prime member! The crate is fine, if the sizing had been accurate. A dog would have to be extremely short to fit this crate!
customer_reviews.author: F.J.

customer_reviews.title: Good for price, small, easily corrected defect
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, arrived on time, relatively easy to put together. I say relatively because, while I was putting in the screws in the corners that keep the top and bottom together, one of the holes was too small to put the bolt through correctly. I had to manually widen it a hair to make it fit. Once put together though, it fit my adult cat fine and was plenty sturdy enough to transport her to the vet with. Not sure I'd recommend it for longer trips though.
customer_reviews.author: Steisi39

customer_reviews.title: If we had more time we’d return for another one
customer_reviews.text: We bought new but it looks like the one that was delivered was used. It’s not broken but very beaten up. I think the product is as expected and will work fine but it’s very scuffed and needs to be cleaned
customer_reviews.author: Mark P

customer_reviews.title: Kitty approves
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the smallest kennel for our cat to use. Boy was it tricky to put together! The pieces have to line up and slide together, which was the tricky part. It's certainly not a kennel to use and take apart often. I love that the door can be removed without taking the kennel apart. Our 8 pound kitty enjoyed it, she's been laying inside it without the door closed. A great purchase for the money! (The one pictured isn't the smallest kennel)
customer_reviews.author: Ippi

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Hard to figure out how to assemble at first. Sliding lock mechanism assures secure attachment, but makes it difficult to easily take the top off (I wanted to do that to help ease crate training, but it was way too inconvenient). The door opens either way using twist levers, but can sometimes be hard to make sure it locks in place. Overall a good crate, but it takes some adjusting. My dog got out the first few times and it's always hard for someone new (my roommate, the dog walker, etc) to figure it out without being there to explain it.
customer_reviews.author: Shops ALot

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as expected
customer_reviews.text: The plastic is thin, doesnt feel very sturdy at all. The most frustrating part was the screws and plastic nuts: they were extremely difficult to screw fit and tight...
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Inside dimensions not given
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in this purchase because the dimensions given are outside dimensions, not inside, so be aware. My puppy is 20 lbs., and already too tall and long for this kennel as inside floor measurements are like 23x15x18. Now, of course, I will shortly be needing to purchase another kennel, and I'm not happy about it. By the way, if you purchase, make sure to put in metal screws as puppy was able to take off top without it being screwed in place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Product
customer_reviews.text: Is very easy to put together no tools needed. The only Con I have found so far is with the door. I have to kind of fiddle with the spring loaded locks to get them lined up to into the holes. Both sides are like that. The can be drilled out just a little bit and I believe it will solve this issue. Other than that everything else is great, it seems sturdy, is light weight so moving it around is easy, my 9 year old daughter can pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Hubcap

customer_reviews.title: More than enough room.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for my little 3 lb chihuahua. Plenty of space.
customer_reviews.author: theladyny

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, no bolts to hold it together
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about this... It didn't come with any bolts so I had to order some. Requires four, one on each corner. DO NOT use this without bolts because it will come apart easily. The door seems solid enough, but the rest of the carrier is cheap and flimsy. I hope the handle holds. I only plan to use this to take my cat on short trips to the Vet. No way would I ever trust this thing on an airplane, bus or train.
customer_reviews.author: Stevewf1

customer_reviews.title: Great dog kennel
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand. I have two in two different sizes. Easy to put together. Travels great! Very sturdy. I have an 18lb dog just so you know the size of dog I own. Highly recommended this!
customer_reviews.author: Mach

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is not the Petmate quality that we are used to. It was flimsy and appearance looked and felt cheap. Also, didn't like the way that it assembled. It was returned the next day.
customer_reviews.author: dferron

customer_reviews.title: top and bottom does not fit together
customer_reviews.text: unable to assemble... tried for over an hour... bottom too wide for top... tiny narrow grooves.. actually even if they fit together, it would not have been sturdy enough given how heavy it was even without a critter in it... should have latches not these stupid groove things that don't fit... should have wheels... can't imagine carrying this with a 50lb dog in it... returned it immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Staats

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to assemble the 20-30 lb kennel
customer_reviews.text: Because the top and bottom don't match well it requires many attempts at following the instructions, pushing the sides in or out, and then a lot of physical strength to force the hard plastic to where the bolts can be inserted.
customer_reviews.author: Standish

customer_reviews.title: Light-weight carrier
customer_reviews.text: Quite difficult to put together in that it has to line up just right or the door won't work. Once we got ours fitted right, it works O.K. It is plastic, so it's not heavy like the more expensive metal ones, but we only wanted a second one to have in the car, so it fit our purpose. Be sure your dog doesn't weigh more than 8 or 9 pounds!
customer_reviews.author: TN grandmother

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Kennel, Slightly Cumbersome Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I found the interlocking tabs for top and bottom to be cumbersome to slide together and get fully locked into place. This would be more of an issue if you break down the crate for frequent travel. Also not a fan of the plastic swivel clasps on the back that lock the two shells into place. Looks like they could snap off fairly easily, and in fact my kennel arrived with one of the two clasps missing. (You can get replacements on the Petmate site for a couple bucks.) Otherwise durable if it doesn't get a lot of rough treatment. I like that the door hinges on both sides, and the door itself seems well made.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Good crate
customer_reviews.text: He plastic is slightly warped making the fit slightly difficult to lock the top and bottom together. It has been very sturdy and we have had no problem keeping our pup inside, even without the fasteners to that lock the top and bottom together. It has been large enough that we have used it as our pups home crate for the first few months, she is about to grow out of it now though, it will still be great for traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my miniature dachshund!
customer_reviews.text: Great kennel for our new miniature dachshund puppy. He'll only get to be a maximum of ten pounds and then kennel is perfect for him. They had the exact same model at my local pet store but wanted an additional $14 for it. You have to put it together when you purchase it from Amazon but it's very easy. I would definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Fool for Christ

customer_reviews.title: Good for cats or dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is an ideal dog crate. The bottom has no holes so if water and/or food spills out of the bowl(s,) it won't leak out of the crate. Doubles as a nice indoor "house" for the dog to stay in. The door opens from either side, nice plus. Little holes to allow airflow and for the pet to see out. Doubles as a nice cat carrier too!
customer_reviews.author: MW-NEO

customer_reviews.title: Good Carrier but no handle
customer_reviews.text: Love the carrier but wish it had a handle.....Have no clue why it doesn't....but it will work for my cat as he isn't very heavy and I'll have to carry it some other way. Built nice but lacks a very important handle.
customer_reviews.author: plw

customer_reviews.title: Good product but can be tricky
customer_reviews.text: Serves our purpose perfectly. A little tricky to build but I figured it out. Having another pair of hands is helpful. It is a perfect size for our 12 pound Buddy. I'm careful about getting the locking pins in place when I lock the gate since he pushed the gate open when I didn't take care with it! I would recommend it to most people.
customer_reviews.author: Netgirl57

customer_reviews.title: For all your Pet Carry-ing needs- choose me!
customer_reviews.text: I have a BIG cat lol. hes pretty large and he fit comfy in this carrier. I was going to buy a used one but found this new one for cheaper! Its easy to assemble and its really durable! I recommend to all animal owners :)
customer_reviews.author: Harleyann Diaz

customer_reviews.title: It's a good kennel! My puppy is 16
customer_reviews.text: It's a good kennel! My puppy is 16,5 lbs and we ordered size 20-30 lbs. Some people say it's small for their dog weight and size when they order it but it should be small, just for potty training and sleeping in there, it shouldn't be too big so dog won't go pee there. I wish it would have a handle through for carrying the crate. It's easy to snap and assembly. Also it came 3 days earlier then expected.
customer_reviews.author: Yulia

customer_reviews.title: Love this carrier!
customer_reviews.text: We use this carrier for occasional transport for vet appointments and checks ups. There is plenty of room for my kitty. This carrier is hard plastic on all sides besides the door and is SUPER EASY TO CLEAN. Ive had this carrier for over 5 years and never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Bermea

customer_reviews.title: More description needed to help buyers
customer_reviews.text: These were way too small for my dogs. In trying to get a good idea of the size, I went by reviews left by other purchasers. Both my dogs are under 20 pounds and it would have taken a plunger to get them into these kennels, which, of course I wasn't willing to do. So, in all fairness, I don't know about ease of use or quality. I would emphasize more description to help someone understand the size.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 5 pound outdoor cat that I have been trying to catch. It was extremely hard to put together and apparently I never got it quite right because the front where the door is, keeps popping open so then the door doesn't work. I finally duck taped it together. I put it in the trash once I got the cat because it is past the return period now.
customer_reviews.author: ANONYMOUS

customer_reviews.title: Great for medium sized rabbits!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this enough. I have a 8 lb rabbit and this is enough room for those very long vet visits where you have to wait sometimes to be seen. I like how the door won't collapse INTO the carrier onto your animal because of the top and bottom door guards, and the door comes completely off and is easy to put back on. I got the 10-20 lb size. Perfect size for my rabbit!
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with the quality of this carrier and returned the item. It was awkward to assemble and the door was difficult to open. Very cheap plastic that I would not trust holding my 9 pound cat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yotee-Dog Is living in a dream house!
customer_reviews.text: The pet crate (bunk at our house) was easy enough for me to assemble and extra hdwr was provided. My dog thinks she has checked into the Palace when she crawls in it. I also like the ease in opening the door and being able to do so from either side of it. We are both very pleased overall.
customer_reviews.author: Almond girl

customer_reviews.text: Works, but the rounder shape makes it harder to stack multiples next to each other and putting together and taking it apart is a bit more difficult than with other crates. Due to the rounded shape the door has less of an opening when swung open. Usable and serves its purpose for transport and containment, but not 5 star user friendly for cleaning and stacking.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Trumbly

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good kennel. We have a 10lb Havachon and it is plenty roomy for her. I only wish it had a little storage compartment to keep a leash or treats, then it would be a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: M.M.D.

product_meta.title: Petmate Compass Plastic Pets Kennel with Chrome Door
product_meta.description: Color:PEARL WHITE/BLACK| Size:50-70LBSThe Petmate Compass Kennel strives for a comfortable and safe experience for pets and peace of mind for pet parents. With the expandable entrance, pet parents can easily assist their pets entering and exiting the plastic kennel. The double-hinged door's turn-dial latches allow easy access for opening on either side, or for complete door removal. The top's slide-on design allows for easy assembly, snapping together in three simple steps, no tools required. Optional hardware is included for additional security. Ventilation openings allow for better visibility and fresh air on all sides, keeping pets comfortable during travel. The Petmate Kennel meets most airline cargo specifications, but pet parents should always check with their airline's specific requirements. The color combination available for this kennel is Pearl White/Black. Kennel is offered in sizes ranging from 10-90 pounds. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Medium Dog Kennel: This cat & dog kennel features a 2-way door that opens on either side for easy pet access and ventilated sides for maximum visibility & air flow. Perfect for dogs 50-70 lbs. Measures 36"

Travel Kennel: Portable kennel has a durable construction & door latches for security. The pet carrier meets most airline cargo specifications for easy sky travel & has a carrying handle for transport.
Kennels & Houses: Crate & kennel training is vital for dog safety & comfort. We provide traditional travel carriers, wire training & exercise kennels, play pens, barn-style dog houses & more

Petmate: For over 50 years, we at Petmate are passionate about our dogs, cats & furry friends in general. Starting with the very first dog kennel, we've produced plenty of eco-friendly products that pets will love.

Just For Pets: Petmate makes a variety of pet products for dogs, cats, chickens & other small furry friends! Check out our brands such as Aspen Pet, Arm & Hammer, Booda, Chuckit!, Jackson Galaxy & more!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
